definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: Because he got rid of his ignorant and uncouth sweetness, he is no longer a boy.
sentences.chinese: 因爲褪去了年少無知和天真爛漫，他就不再是孩子了。

sentences.english: We are still young and ignorant, the promise of a lifetime that we can not afford.
sentences.chinese: 我們都還年少無知，那些一輩子的承諾我們許不起。

sentences.english: But I was young and foolish, And now I'm full of tears.
sentences.chinese: 可我，那時年少無知，如今悔淚滔滔。

sentences.english: Ignorance of us, many things wrong.
sentences.chinese: 年少無知的我們，做錯了許多事。

definition: to make fun of/to seek diversion
start explaining and it's a long story (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
ashamed and unable to show one's face
Jiang Yan has exhausted his talent (idiom)/fig. to have used up one's creative powers/to have writer's block
to get straight to the point (idiom)
lit. to play the lute to a cow (idiom)/fig. offering a treat to an unappreciative audience/to cast pearls before swine/caviar to the general/to preach to deaf ears/to talk over sb's head
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
